`weapons:
leveler/bertha: halved the dmg per shot, but added a breach effect. It's now a more specialized armor cracker as the effect wont deal extra dmg to shield or hull.
tyrfing: dmg per shot 300 -> 400, dmg per second was kept the same.
scorpion: nerfed flux/shot and overall accuracy.
demohammer: nerfex flux/shot.
mallet: nerfed the dmg to 2000 and made it cheaper to install.
new weapon Heavy Swarmer: large Swarmer with an autoforge and very low op cost.

wings:
ascalon: reduced tachlance range and dmg. 
talismans: reduced fighter per wing by one and made them cheaper.
thunderbolts: nerfed its toughness overall, they were way to strong.
LG variant: now uses a limited ammo HE cannon and a pair of Gazer DEMS. System changed to a single use teleport... yes it will teleport directly to the target when ordered to engage.

ships:
gunther(LG): system changed to a longer range (but longer cooldown) phase skimmer.
falcon(LG prototype): added energy bolt coherer.
Tirpitz(baseline):  swapped the builtin talons for talismans.
Spee(baseline: DP 35 -> 30.
Spee(P): 100 less armor, 10 more topspeed (and a bit more maneuverability).`

items.name: Better Combat
items.summary:
Current version:
https://gitlab.com/starsector/better_combat/-/archive/main/better_combat-main.zip
items.description:
Current version:
https://gitlab.com/starsector/better_combat/-/archive/main/better_combat-main.zip
Releases:
https://gitlab.com/starsector/better_combat/-/releases

Better combat is a mod that aims to make starsector combat more fun by modifying values, and adds a few small features. 

All configureable.
Safe to add and remove.

Compatible with secrets of the frontier
Integrated with luna lib

With default settings, ships have a much faster top speed, but take much longer to accelerate to top speed. Allong with this, the map size and weapon range is changed for longer range gameplay.

Added Features:
bigger asteroids
asteroids split on destruction
ship fragments move more when a ship is destroyed
PPT and CR reduced by ship damage(disabled by default)
Dynamic Zero Flux speed boost based on ship speed(disabled by default)

Values better combat allows you to modify:
map size
ship deployment location and spacing
max zoom out of the combat camera
how far ships reveal fog of war
weapon range & damage
projectile speed
missile speed & manuverability
missile submunition properties
fighter range & speed
ship speed, acceleration, hull, armor, shield, phase, flux, ordanance points, explosion size, PPT, bounds radius.
Phase global values

You can also modify values of particular weapons and ships using a query system.

Thanks to Liral for the map code
Thanks to Crablobab for the asteroid code
Thanks to Maelstrom for suggesting and testing features.

showcase video. Several fixes and updates have been made since then: https://youtu.be/mikU8sxLbuU

items.name: BoxUtil
items.summary: **Made by Shiozakana**
items.description:
**Made by Shiozakana**

Safe to add mid game, NOT safe to remove IF YOU HAVE MADE A SAVE with it.

0.98 Ver Download Link
https://github.com/MycophobiaSC/BoxUtill_Temp/releases/download/0.98-1.3.5/BoxUtil.-1.3.5.zip
0.97 Version Download Link
https://github.com/MycophobiaSC/BoxUtill_Temp/releases/tag/0.97

**Forum Post**
(https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=32003.msg469937#msg469937)

**User Manual (In Chinese)**
https://www.fossic.org/thread-15746-1-1.html

BoxUtil is developed based on OpenGL 4.2 and uses various core functions of OpenGL 4.2-4.3

Based around Instantiated rendering and GPU calculation, it allows for more efficient rendering option of higher quality, while still being usable on most player's setups.

**For Modders -** This mod provide various method for static and instance class, and provides parent API class where possible. It provides various simple to use rendering setting and further customization or rewrite methods. Together with several management class to allow for centralized data processing and rendering.

**For players- **Currently BoxUtil provide two types FXAA anti-aliasing option with different quality and spec requirement, this allows fairly good graphic experience when the base game anti-alising is turned off after using GraphicsLib.

[**Notes**
For most function of BoxUtil, you must have a graphic card that support OpenGL 4.2 and it requires the game to run on this graphic card for it to operate properly. Instantiated rendering will require at least OpenGL 4.3 support.

You can check your graphic cards using softwares like GPU-Z. For MacOS, most likely they would not be able to use OpenGL function of higher version.

If you would need to change game UI zoom, please try to change them in increments of 50%.

**Settings**
The mod comes its own config panel on the bottom left, which include two icons, the left one governs basic functions and the right one governs OpenGL4.3 functions.

Normally, if the icon is green, it is usable, if it is red, it is not operational. Clicking them opens a setting panel.

Global setting option requires a full restart of the game to function, rest should work after saving the changes. If a setting is red, it is not functional given your current spec.

**TL Note**
Unfortunately for a dedicated lib like this, most of the more complex function are too complicated for me to understand, let alone translate, so most detailed function explanation may have some mistakes. I have tried my best to outline the main points of the original post, and an english Java doc is enclosed that could help. However, if anyone can provide a better overview, I'd greatly appreciate it.

items.name: Experimental Hull Modifications 0.8.7HF2 (0.98a Hotfix)
items.summary: Fork of <@259007154286100481>'s Experimental Hull Modifications, compatible with 0.98a. Fixed by <@142592906178330624>  and pantsmode.
items.description:
Fork of <@259007154286100481>'s Experimental Hull Modifications, compatible with 0.98a. Fixed by <@142592906178330624>  and pantsmode.

Unparalleled ship customization at your fingertips. Customize shields & engines, change systems, alter slot types / sizes with these new hull modifications and slot shunts!
 
# FOREWARNING
The 'Experimental' in the title is not just for novelty. Please use "Save Copy" before using this mod; in other words, back your save up.
The goal of this mod is providing extreme customization; balance isn't on any priority list. Extreme cases will be adjusted but that's pretty much it.

In addition, this version of the mod WILL NOT be supported by lyravega or Wisp. I am NOT a coder, and therefore am NOT experienced with fixing Java bugs. If you find major issues with this version, please only report them to **ME**, pantsmode, and I will attempt to fix them. Lyra is currently working on refactoring the entire mod from the ground up for its' next addition, and so, cannot assist with fixes on this version. This version WILL NOT be compatible with the next version of EHM released by Lyra as a result.

I *MAY* create a fork of this mod (with Lyra's permission) that has changes that I find might be valuable. This version is *NOT* guaranteed to be save-compatible with the hotfixed version, is *NOT* guaranteed to work, and may *NOT* even release at all.

**If you understand that in full**, feel free to download.

Hull Modifications: Will become available immediately
 Experimental Hull Modifications: Provides a base to all other hull modifications in this mod
 Over-Engineered: Provides 20% OP bonus and some slot-points to the ship when built-in
 Logistics Overhaul: Strips the ship of all combat capabilities in favour of logistics
 Auxiliary Generators: Provides some slot-points in exchange for ordnance points
 AI Switch: Turns automated ships into normal, or normal ships into automated ones

Hull Modification Categories: Will become available immediately
 Systems: Most vanilla systems are turned into hull modifications
 Retrofits: Alters the weapon slots of a ship all together
 Cosmetics: Fully customizable hull modifications to change shield and engine colours. Customization is done through the mod settings menu
 Activators: Uses slot shunts to provide the ship with various enhancements by altering the slot they're installed on

Slot Shunt Categories: May be obtained after activating the new ability. These, along with their activators alter the ship in different ways
 Adapters: Turns a bigger slot into smaller versions (3 large, 1 medium types)
 Converters: Turns a smaller slot into a bigger one by using slot points (1 medium, 1 small types)
 Diverters: Turns a slot inactive and yield slot points to be used by above (1 small type)
 Capacitors: Enhances the total flux capacity of the ship (1 small type)
 Dissipators: Enhances the total flux dissipation of the ship (1 small type)
 Launch Tubes: Turns a large slot into a fighter hangar (1 large type)

```ansi

[2;31m- Cannot be removed; back your save up[0m
```

items.name: Keyboard As Mouse - An Accessibility(?) Mod
items.summary: This mod is built on a sort of library I'm referring to as True Input Faker, which it uses to generate fake mouse events (and possibly fake keyboard events in the future) by injecting itself between Starsector and the LWJGL game library it's built on.
items.description:
This mod is built on a sort of library I'm referring to as True Input Faker, which it uses to generate fake mouse events (and possibly fake keyboard events in the future) by injecting itself between Starsector and the LWJGL game library it's built on.

Mostly a proof of concept, this mod is a simplistic "accessibility" mod that allows using the keyboard to control the in-game cursor. This includes using the keyboard for:
* Left clicks
* Right clicks
* Mouse movement
* Scrolling
* Click-and-hold/drag

This isn't entirely ergonomic, and there are still some quirks/bugs (notably, basically all input except mouse movement, scrolling and clicks will not be processed when an inventory item stack is selected).

However, strictly speaking, everything in the game that requires a mouse can be controlled via the keyboard with this mod, even the combat layer though it's extremely difficult to do so. There's also plenty of overlap between the default keybinds I've chosen and the game's keybinds, though those can be reconfigured fairly easily.

Requires LazyLib.
Optionally depends on LunaLib for editing keybinds.

Source: <https://github.com/atlanticaccent/true-input-faker>
Download: <https://github.com/atlanticaccent/true-input-faker/releases/download/0.0.1/true-input-faker.zip>

items.name: Leading Pip
items.summary: This mod adds a target leading pip in front of whatever ship you have targeted.  If you shoot at that pip, you will generally hit the target.  The algorithm takes into account your position and velocity, your target's position and velocity, your weapon group, the positions of the weapons in the weapon group, the projectile speed of the weapons in the weapon group, and the acceleration and max speed of rocket-type missiles.
items.description:
This mod adds a target leading pip in front of whatever ship you have targeted.  If you shoot at that pip, you will generally hit the target.  The algorithm takes into account your position and velocity, your target's position and velocity, your weapon group, the positions of the weapons in the weapon group, the projectile speed of the weapons in the weapon group, and the acceleration and max speed of rocket-type missiles.

Highly customizable, including various display modes (combined vs. individual pips, for instance).

```Version 1.10.2 (May 27, 2025)
- Leading pips on station/ship modules now take the mothership's rotation and velocity into account```

items.description:
I've played the game several time and always found myself avoiding cruiser class ships because their use seem suboptimal. So I decided to create the ship collection which I would love to use in my own play-throughs with the following constraints in mind:
1) Ships must be fun to pilot
2) They should perfectly blend into the game
3) Building them should be quite straight forward, while still offering some room for experimentation
4) Ships need to be balanced 
5) Cruisers should have a nice progression and age well with s-mods and more experienced officers

As a result I've created a Lobster ship lineup:

items.name: More Combat Terrain Effects
items.summary: REQUIRES LAZYLIB, LUNALIB, MAGICLIB
items.description:
REQUIRES LAZYLIB, LUNALIB, MAGICLIB

Adds custom combat effects to all terrain that did not have an effect previously, and spruces up the rest.
Currently implemented:
```Magnetic field - Reduces weapon range, fighter range, missile maneuverability/guidance, vision range, and adds a small chance for missiles to have guidance scrambled.
Slipstream - Force SO on all ships, fighters, and MISSILES, (venting allowed but with reduced effectiveness, for things like excelsior), slowly passively generate hardflux.
Nebula (DISABLED BY DEFAULT): Nebula clouds reduce weapon range, vision, speed, and disable zero-flux boost while inside of them.
Deep hyperspace: Spawn nebula clouds. Hyperstorms will cause these clouds to zap anyone who draws near them, periodically, with a very powerful EMP bolt.
Black Holes: Drags all entities in combat towards the black hole, and increases time dilation of all ships.
Pulsars: Pushes all entities in combat away from the pulsar, reduces shield stats (efficiency, more upkeep, emp arc pierce chance), slowly generates hardflux, randomly EMPs ships, and charges all projectiles with a flat bonus to EMP damage.
Meson Field (More Planetary Conditions): Normally increases non-missile weapon range and vision range by a moderate amount, but in storms significantly increases all weapon range, wing range, system range, and vision range.```

Additionally, adds combat effects to campaign objectives. Fight near your comms relay to get bonus CP regen!

**Safe to add and remove from saves.**

Download: https://github.com/nikothedude/MoreCombatTerrainEffects/releases
Repo: https://github.com/nikothedude/MoreCombatTerrainEffects/tree/master
Forum thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=25567.0

items.name: Nightcross Armory Corporation
items.summary: https://github.com/YukiMonsai/nightcross-armory/releases
items.description:
https://github.com/YukiMonsai/nightcross-armory/releases

This is a faction I've been working on for some time. I first started modding back in 2019, before going on hiatus and coming back around 0.97, at which point I found out to my amazement that my source code *mostly* still worked!

Contains:
- one capital, three cruisers, three destroyers, and two frigates. Generally high tech with light armor, high movement speed, high flux capacity, but relatively low flux dissipation, offset by a universal hullmod for shielded ships that reduces flux costs when shields are off for a high risk/reward playstyle. They also lose zero-flux bonus when they sustain hull damage, to make them less frustrating to play against them when they have long-ranged weapons.
- 5 fighter LPCs (still trying to figure out fighter balance in general)
- About 30 or so factional weapons, including 3 types of missiles and a bunch of energy, synergy, and hybrid types. Energy weapons generally deal less damage with worse efficiency than most energy weapons, but longer range. The beams are the opposite--more damage than common beam weapons, but less range.
- One modular hullmod (Plasma Aggregator)
- A star system with independent/pirate markets including special submarkets that sell NCA gear (since they don't have any official market)
- Graphicslib integration (normal maps only), plus fancy lights and doodads.

```fix
1.5.0:
- Updated for Starsector version 0.98a and Java 17
- Fixed a rare error that could occur intermittently while loading saves for some users
- Added support for specifying the minimum abundance capacity and abundance per month of operation types
- Added support for forcing operations to spawn at colonized planets
- Added support for defining specific planetary conditions as op requirements, even if they're part of a condition group
- Changed: By default, planet ops may no longer require skills to perform (to improve out-of-the-box compatibility with Second in Command)
- Changed: New operations are now created any time newly added operation types are detected. Previously this only occurred if an update to this mod was also detected.
- Improved addition of newly added operations to more closely resemble initial spawn distribution
```

items.name: Ore Refinery
items.summary:
A cargo space compression utility mod that adds 6 new toggle abilities (Ore Refinery,  Rare Ore Refinery,  Bio Refinery ,Volatiles Refinery, Fuel Compression 
and Food Compression) that refine resources found in mining stations, orbital habitats or from the Nexerelin mod mining feature by using heavy machinery and forges them into custom manufactured commodities that take up less space.
items.description:
A cargo space compression utility mod that adds 6 new toggle abilities (Ore Refinery,  Rare Ore Refinery,  Bio Refinery ,Volatiles Refinery, Fuel Compression 
and Food Compression) that refine resources found in mining stations, orbital habitats or from the Nexerelin mod mining feature by using heavy machinery and forges them into custom manufactured commodities that take up less space.

I  envision this mod as a space saver and the conversion ratio stays the same with the bonuses applied from gantries and nanoforges, only the amount used and made is increased not the overall value. I have balanced the output to be as near to the input in value and all new custom commodities are effected by market demand valuation using their base commodity demand. items.name: Random Weapon Collection
items.summary: Adds a few ships and weapons I came up with.
items.description:
Adds a few ships and weapons I came up with.  

If you have a good idea for something I should add, let me know.
Balance feedback is appreciated.
Feel free to ping me.

## Contains: ##
## Ships ##
Egret- Midline capital carrier very similar to the Heron
Onslaught (B)- Onslaught variant with a beam TPC.  Does not spawn in NPC fleets/markets currently.
Conqueror- Midline battleship, fast but very poor rear arcs.  Comes with 2 fighter bays.
Javelin- Midline cruiser with AAF.  Main armament is 4 medium ballistics.
Polaris- Midline battlecarrier with reloading Harpoon launchers.
Viper- Midline frigate with AAF.
Barrage-Capital ship made out of station parts.  Slow, but heavy firepower.
Viking -Missile frigate
Warhawk- Very mobile cruiser, based on the Falcon. 
Hurricane-  high tech frigate with Terminator drones.
Vulcan-  cross between the Onslaught and Conquest.
Triumphant-  broadside capital ship with heavy armor.

## Weapons ##
Devastation- Large slot HE ballistic weapon.   Will show up in mercenary fleets occasionally.
Mjolnir Heavy Cannon- Triple-barrel Mjolnir, good luck finding something with the flux to use this well. 
Autopulse Beam- Designed as a shitpost, is just an Autopulse Laser that was turned into a beam weapon.  Does not spawn in NPC fleets/markets currently.
Plasma Beam- Similar to the Autopulse Beam, but based on the Plasma Cannon.  Does not spawn in NPC fleets/markets currently.
Tachyon Accelerator- Projectile variant of Tachyon Lance.  Does not pierce shields.
Light Mjolnir- Single-barrel Mjolnir, fits in medium slots.
Heavy Positron Cannon- Hybrid large weapon.  Probably needs more balancing.
Positron Cannon- Hybrid medium weapon.  
Piledriver Heavy Railcannon- Large kinetic ballistic. 
Harpoon Missile Battery-Large slot Harpoon launcher.
Phase Beam Battery- triple phase beam in a large slot.  High damage output, bad range and slightly less flux efficient than the standard Phase Lance.
Flash HVM- Very maneuverable missile with a relatively short lockon range.  Great against lighter ships, and comes in small, medium, and large sizes.

## Wings ##
Wildcat- DEM bomber

Can be added mid-playthrough and should function correctly if done.

Changelog:
``` - Added support for character sheet tab
 - Added support for fleet tab
 - Added support for Refit tab (incredibly basic, mostly just a mouse emulator)
 - Tweaked support for crew/cargo tab so that navigating from it to the adjacent tabs works
 - Added support for map tab (mostly a mouse editor, but it does support toggling sector/system view)
 - Added support for the intel tabs (including support for the main Intel, planets, and faction sub-tabs)
 - Added support for the Command tab (same as Refit currently, just a mouse emulator)
 - On the main campaign view, added support for selecting ship abilities/hotkeys, the current ability is highlighted with a yellow reticle, and you press B to activate the selected ability.
 - Added support for various message boxes that show up throughout the game, for instance the one that shows in campaign view when supplies run low.

items.name: Shackles Garrison[XXVII] v1.0.0
items.summary: Add a mid-tech battle group. Having some vanilla-like ships. Having some special faction weapons, but all of these are build-in their ships.
items.description:
Add a mid-tech battle group. Having some vanilla-like ships. Having some special faction weapons, but all of these are build-in their ships. 

Starsector Mod by Yisic/Diling
Proofread by Mycophobia

Requires Graphic Lib/Lazy Lib/Magic Lib/Nex

```Lore```
XXVII - Shakeles Garrison
Shackles Garrison is comprised of the remnants of the XXVII Battlegroup, disillusioned with human rule after being left adrift for an extended period of time after the Collapse, seeing themselves as abandoned by the rest of humanity. Their arrival in the Sector was originally marked by a willingness to collaborate, but the geopolitically volatile environment of the Sector caused them to be embroiled in significant conflict with both Tri-Tachyon Technology and the Hegemony. These conflicts resulted in the annihilation of the Garrison's capital planet and significant fleet losses, forcing the faction to retreat to a small star system outside of the Core Worlds.

The net effect of these conflicts was to transform the Shackles Garrison from a disillusioned, somewhat cynical, but fundamentally collaborative faction with a decently-sized military force into a civilization driven almost exclusively by revenge. Specifically, a cold, patient, seething determination to exact vengeance on those who ultimately killed billions of their people, after they had arrived in the Sector with cooperative intentions. For now, they were weak, beaten, unthreatening - but they would bide their time, marshal their forces, sharpen their blades - and then there would be hell to pay.

It will be better if you start your new run after you finish all XXVII missions. Because those missions will give you some reward. 

``Newest Ver is: v1.0.0
``
```Download```

items.summary: ***Warning:** We __strongly recommend__ setting your frame rate cap in data/config/settings.json to **at least 120** to avoid AI and hit detection issues!*
items.description:
***Warning:** We __strongly recommend__ setting your frame rate cap in data/config/settings.json to **at least 120** to avoid AI and hit detection issues!*

Ever wish the game would go by quicker while you're flying your lumbering Paragon up to the line of battle?  Ever wanted to push "fast forward" while your fleet mopped up the remnants of an enemy fleet?  Ever wanted to speed through a trivial Derelicts fight?  This mod is for you!

Hold the middle mouse button and the game becomes 2x faster.  You can also press the caps lock key to toggle fast mode at your leisure.  The B button toggles the slow-down effect of phase systems.

The following are *NOT RECOMMENDED* for pitched battles due to causing problems with AI and hit detection: F3 applies a 6x multiplier, and control-capslock causes the game to run in as-fast-as-possible mode.

Controls are fully customizable by editing SpeedUp/data/config/SPEED_UP.json.  You can even set custom time scaling factors on separate inputs, if you like.


```Version 1.2.2 (April 7, 2025)
- Updated for Starsector 0.98a-RC7
- Improved the calculation for calculating dynamic speed multipliers

Version 1.2.1 (March 31, 2025)
- Updated for Starsector 0.98a
- Fixed a logical bug preventing dynamic changes in speed multipliers```

items.summary: ***CAN BE ADDED TO A SAVE (USE SA_generateAugments AND SA_genSpecialContent COMMANDS) - CANNOT BE REMOVED***
items.description:
***CAN BE ADDED TO A SAVE (USE SA_generateAugments AND SA_genSpecialContent COMMANDS) - CANNOT BE REMOVED***

Adds station "augments" which allow you to modify your orbital station. While not as expansive as hullmods, this collection will still make stations just a bit more engaging.

Augments can be find by salvaging and at markets, and are an uncommon find. They do NOT dilute the loot pool, instead adding more loot in total. Augments can also be obtained by destroying a station with augments.
Augments are also applied to NPC markets, including modded markets.

The entire augment system was designed with other mods in mind, meaning other mods can create their own augments and apply augments to their own markets without a hard dependency.

Forum: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=30583.0

items.name: The Second Battlegroup
items.summary: The Second Battlegroup is an elite line of ships that can be found as derelict outside of the Core Systems (Like XIV Legion). But for gameplay purposes, their blueprint can also be found individually.
items.description:
The Second Battlegroup is an elite line of ships that can be found as derelict outside of the Core Systems (Like XIV Legion). But for gameplay purposes, their blueprint can also be found individually. 

Their combat doctrine is "Adamantium Lance" which focuses on using overwhelming firepower to break through the enemy lines. They usually emphasize large, frontal weaponry while ignoring point defence, and some ships have slightly modified weapon arcs to perfect their job.

Their Battlegroup bonus is quite similar to the XIV, but the bonus and penalty are all increased. Overall, they are stronger than XIV ships. Due to the change in weapon systems, they usually cost 20-25% more DP compared to their vanilla counterparts and cost 3x as much (XIV ships cost 1.75x). Auxiliary ships have lower bonuses and less radical restructuring, so they only cost 1.5x as much.

```Changelog:
v1.0.0: Release
v1.0.1: Fixed the bugs that the Lance of Oblivion will turn and Player fleet won't spawn these ship even if it has the blueprint

v1.1.0: Added Champion (II)
v1.2.0: Added Kite (II) (A) and Shepherd (II) (A). Also changed the color of Second Battlegroup Auxilia design.
```

items.description:
A mod that allows player fleet to scan entire star system at the cost of volatiles CR and time.
Made by Nitori_Tachyon
Fossic post: https://www.fossic.org/forum.php?mod=viewthread&tid=15140&extra=page%3D1
Forum link:https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=32638.0
Github link:https://github.com/SaltyKarl/Thorough-System-Scan/tree/EN
 Requires both LunaLib and LazyLib
the rest is English translation of the Fossic post
# System Wide Sensor Scan

### Adds an initially available campaign ability that allows the player to perform a System Wide Sensor Scan after a number of prerequisites have been met in order to discover salvage-worthy objects in the current system and temporarily have a view of all fleets in the system .

The prerequisites are as follows:

   Fleet sensor strength of at least 1000 (Can be adjusted via LunaLib).
   Have enough volatiles in the cargo bay (see later for numerical calculations)
   Be in the scanning position of the current system (see later for definition)

Skill effects are as follows:

   -Consume a certain amount of volatiles
   -Finds and marks salvageable objects across the system
   -Temporarily obtains detailed information on the location and composition of all fleets in the system (from about three-quarters of the way through the end of the scan).
   -Player fleets are highly visible and limited in movement speed during skill activation.
   -Reduces the readiness of several ships in the fleet that provide sensor strength (see later for details).
   -Reports the **expected** number of special items (including AI cores, ship blueprints, fighter wing blueprints, weapon blueprints, ship insertion blueprints, colony industrial specials, etc.) carried by all salvageable objects in the system at the completion of the scan, which may deviate slightly from the actual value (can be turned off in LunaLib)

items.name: Tinyverse - The Wanzer Age
items.summary:
With the introduction of Diable Avionics into the sector and their military successes thanks to reintroducing the long abandoned technology of Wanzers, giant piloted mechanized robots capable of fighting both in-planet and out in the vacuum of space, showcased that it was time to consider the era of dominance of the spaceship and fighters had come to an end.
Factions all over the sector have scrambled to bring back old, forgotten relics out of the dusty hangars where they had been forgotten. Others have used their ample monetary resources to acquire Wanzer blueprints and schematics from both legal and more illicit means, and others have straight-up used their vast production powers to jumpstart their Wanzer development programs. A new arms race has begun.
items.description:
With the introduction of Diable Avionics into the sector and their military successes thanks to reintroducing the long abandoned technology of Wanzers, giant piloted mechanized robots capable of fighting both in-planet and out in the vacuum of space, showcased that it was time to consider the era of dominance of the spaceship and fighters had come to an end.
Factions all over the sector have scrambled to bring back old, forgotten relics out of the dusty hangars where they had been forgotten. Others have used their ample monetary resources to acquire Wanzer blueprints and schematics from both legal and more illicit means, and others have straight-up used their vast production powers to jumpstart their Wanzer development programs. A new arms race has begun.
Far from the core, mysterious forces noted these developments, and machines of eras past awakened in response. Binary messages spread across the sector's edge with one order: create a response, and new unspeakable things crawled out from dark shadows in the abyss.
The age of the Wanzer had begun.

Content:

This mod adds a large variety of Wanzer frames wings to all vanilla factions for both players to fight and utilize! It also adds unique Ace pilot Wings that can be found as rare bps.

- 6 Mass-production Wanzers
- 3 Unique Mass-production Wanzer variants for The Diktat, The Luddic Path, and Pirates
- 2 Wanzers for [REDACTED]
- 4 Ace Pilot Wanzers, whose Rare blueprints you can find and collect!

Download here:
https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=32954.0

- I suck at math, balance was tried, expect me to have failed

- My first mod ever, if it explodes is your fault and totally not mine.
- Feedback is not only welcomed but appreciated, just please be polite, my tiny heart is sensitive and tiny

   . Atmospheric conditions tend to favour Thin Atmosphere.
- Reverted Military Virus production bonus to +3 (was +4).
- Fixed Crashed Drone having an incorrect size 6 effect.
- Some minor optimization to stat calculations to prevent weird rounding errors.
```

If you've been using an older version by manually updating the version number then it should be save compatible but no guarantees.

items.name: [0.98a]SSMSControllerEx v1.1 - Controller support
items.summary: This mod adds support for using a controller in Starsector. Currently works on the title screen, certain spots in campaign, and in combat. Based heavily off the good work by razuhl with his SSMSController mod https://github.com/razuhl/SSMSController
items.description:
This mod adds support for using a controller in Starsector. Currently works on the title screen, certain spots in campaign, and in combat. Based heavily off the good work by razuhl with his SSMSController mod https://github.com/razuhl/SSMSController 

Requires LunaLib & LazyLib

Current controllers supported:
- On windows, PS4, Switch Pro, and XBox 360
- On Linux, PS4, Switch Pro, and Steam Deck
If your controller is unsupported, a special button auto-mapper UI will appear on the title screen prompting you to enter the button corresponding with a given button icon on the screen. Once it's finished, the controller should work

Patch notes for v1.1 
> Campaign view:
>  - Added support for using controller on the campaign view, you can point the ship in a direction with the left joystick and use the A button to move the ship.
>  - Added support for using the controller in multi-choice dialogs, use up-down on the joystick to choose an option and A to select
> Combat view:
>  - Added support for closing the message box that shows above the deployment view the first time you enter the screen
>  - Added support for the deployment UI, use up-down to toggle the focus between the ships and the buttons and use A to click a button or deploy a ship.
>  - Added VERY VERY basic support for the war room, really just the ability to pause/unpause, and close the war room (aka switch to ship control)
> General bugfixes:
>  - The on-screen controller mappings now show as a proper window with a border, this keeps it from blending in with the screen
>  - Right trigger wasn't working properly, ship would thrust forever unless you held left trigger, should be fixed now
>  - Left/right bumper weren't mapped properly on Steam Deck on Linux, should be fixed now
>  - Left/right trigger weren't mapped properly on PS4 controller on Windows
>  - Support for salvage view and market view are coming 

[Download link](https://github.com/katemonster33/SSMSControllerEx/releases/download/v1.1/SSMSControllerEx_v1.1.zip)
